definition: United Kingdom/British/England/English/abbr. for 英國|英国[Ying1 guo2]
grass radical 草字頭兒|草字头儿[cao3 zi4 tou2 r5]
United Kingdom 聯合王國|联合王国[Lian2 he2 wang2 guo2]/United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland/abbr. for England 英格蘭|英格兰[Ying1 ge2 lan2]
inch (unit of length equal to 2.54 cm.)
Ma Ying-jeou (1950-), Taiwanese Kuomintang politician, Mayor of Taipei 1998-2006, president of Republic of China 2008-2016
foot (unit of length equal to 0.3048 m)
mile (unit of length equal to 1.609 km)

sentences.english: Europeanization is the output of language contact between the English and Chinese language.
sentences.chinese: 汉语的欧化现象是鸦片战争以来英汉语言接触的产物。

sentences.english: The aim of this thesis is to compare and study the differences of phatic language between English and Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 本论文旨在对比研究应酬语在英汉语中的区别。

sentences.english: This difference is caused by different attributes of English and Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 它们的差异是由英汉语不同的语言属性决定的。

sentences.english: I very much want to buy the English dictionary, but unfortunately Idon't have enough money on me.
sentences.chinese: 我很想买这本英书契典，遗憾的是我身上带的钱不够。

sentences.english: I'm going to buy some story-books and a Chinese-English and English-Chinese dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 我要去买些故事书和一个中国的英国和英汉语词典。

sentences.english: RenShun crying to be good English explanation, but good English coldly leave.
sentences.chinese: 仁顺哭着向善英解释，但是善英冷冷地离去。

sentences.english: Simile makes the finishing point in Chinese and English.
sentences.chinese: 在英汉语言中，明喻都起到了画龙点睛的作用。

sentences.english: Imperial Britain savaged India and Burma.
sentences.chinese: 英帝国残暴地攻击印度和缅甸。

sentences.english: Bristol is in the west of England.
sentences.chinese: 布里斯托尔位于英兰西。

sentences.english: Both Jesus and Alexander died at age 33.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣和亚歷山大都死于三十三岁的英年。

sentences.english: King Henry said she was unfaithful to him and eventually had her killed.
sentences.chinese: 英王亨利说安对他不忠，最后还将她处死。

sentences.english: Don't you see: Britain and Japan, only three islands, still prosper.
sentences.chinese: 君不见英日区区三岛尚崛起。

sentences.english: Ineos has a large traditional refinery business.
sentences.chinese: 英力士在传统是由提炼业务中占有很大比例。

sentences.english: This position guarantees continuity as Beijing Playhouse goes from show to show.
sentences.chinese: 该职位保证北京中英百老汇各个演出间的连续性。

sentences.english: OK. But you he to promise me that you will study hard in your English class.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，那么你得答应我你会更勤奋地把英文学得更好。

sentences.english: KoSa is now part of Koch’s Invista unit.
sentences.chinese: 科莎公司现为科赫公司英威达部门的一部分。

(old) third person singular pronoun ("he" or "she")/second person singular pronoun ("you")/(May 4th period) third person singular feminine pronoun ("she")/(Classical Chinese) introductory particle with no specific meaning/that (preceding a noun)
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
